verses.kjv: And the word of the LORD came unto Jonah the second time, saying,
verses.web: LORD’s word came to Jonah the second time, saying,
verses.ct: Then the word of the LORD came to Jonah a second time:

verses.kjv: Arise, go unto Nineveh, that great city, and preach unto it the preaching that I bid thee.
verses.web: “Arise, go to Nineveh, that great city, and preach to it the message that I give you.”
verses.ct: "Get up and go to the great city of Nineveh. Deliver the message I give you."

verses.kjv: So Jonah arose, and went unto Nineveh, according to the word of the LORD. Now Nineveh was an exceeding great city of three days’ journey.
verses.web: So Jonah arose, and went to Nineveh, according to LORD’s word. Now Nineveh was an exceedingly great city, three days’ journey across.
verses.ct: This time, Jonah obeyed and went to Nineveh, just as the LORD told him. Nineveh was an enormous city — so large it took 3 days to walk across it.

verses.kjv: And Jonah began to enter into the city a day’s journey, and he cried, and said, Yet forty days, and Nineveh shall be overthrown.
verses.web: Jonah began to enter into the city a day’s journey, and he cried out, and said, “In forty days, Nineveh will be overthrown!”
verses.ct: Jonah walked into the city for a full day, calling out his warning: "In 40 days, Nineveh will be destroyed!"

verses.kjv: So the people of Nineveh believed God, and proclaimed a fast, and put on sackcloth, from the greatest of them even to the least of them.
verses.web: The people of Nineveh believed God; and they proclaimed a fast, and put on sackcloth, from their greatest even to their least.
verses.ct: The people of Nineveh believed God. They declared a fast, and everyone — from the most powerful to the poorest — put on sackcloth.

verses.kjv: For word came unto the king of Nineveh, and he arose from his throne, and he laid his robe from him, and covered him with sackcloth, and sat in ashes.
verses.web: The news reached the king of Nineveh, and he arose from his throne, and took off his royal robe, covered himself with sackcloth, and sat in ashes.
verses.ct: When the news reached the king of Nineveh, he got up from his throne, took off his royal robe, covered himself with sackcloth, and sat down in ashes.

verses.kjv: And he caused it to be proclaimed and published through Nineveh by the decree of the king and his nobles, saying, Let neither man nor beast, herd nor flock, taste any thing: let them not feed, nor drink water:
verses.web: He made a proclamation and published through Nineveh by the decree of the king and his nobles, saying, “Let neither man nor animal, herd nor flock, taste anything; let them not feed, nor drink water;
verses.ct: Then he and his nobles issued an official decree throughout the city: "No person or animal — not even the herds or flocks — is to eat or drink anything.

verses.kjv: But let man and beast be covered with sackcloth, and cry mightily unto God: yea, let them turn every one from his evil way, and from the violence that is in their hands.
verses.web: but let them be covered with sackcloth, both man and animal, and let them cry mightily to God. Yes, let them turn everyone from his evil way, and from the violence that is in his hands.
verses.ct: Every person and every animal must be covered in sackcloth. Everyone must cry out to God with everything they have. Each person must turn away from their evil ways and from the violence they've been doing.

verses.kjv: Who can tell if God will turn and repent, and turn away from his fierce anger, that we perish not?
verses.web: Who knows whether God will not turn and relent, and turn away from his fierce anger, so that we might not perish?”
verses.ct: Who knows? Perhaps God will change his mind and turn from his fierce anger, so that we don't perish."

verses.kjv: And God saw their works, that they turned from their evil way; and God repented of the evil, that he had said that he would do unto them; and he did it not.
verses.web: God saw their works, that they turned from their evil way. God relented of the disaster which he said he would do to them, and he didn’t do it.
verses.ct: God saw what they did — that they truly turned from their evil ways. So God relented and did not bring the disaster he had threatened against them.
